pnp:Property.Value: This is the default template for projects that comes with Project Portal 365. Will be overwritten during an upgrade.
This is the default template for parent projects that comes with Project Portal 365. Will be overwritten during an upgrade.
This is the default template for programs that comes with Project Portal 365. Will be overwritten during an upgrade.

pnp:DataRow.pnp:DataValue: Is there a clearly defined problem statement that highlights the need for further investigation?
Has it been clarified how or by whom the investigation will be financed?
Is it most appropriate to carry out the initiative as a project or as a line task?
Is the initiative in accordance with the business strategy?
Is more information needed before a decision can be made?
Have the guidelines (IT-political or others) that apply and must be considered in the investigation been clarified?
Should we proceed to the concept phase and investigate different concepts for a possible project?
Is the project realistic and feasible?
Has a project steering committee been established?
Has a role description for the project owner been established?
Has a benefits manager been appointed and role description established?
Does the project proposal support the organization's goals and strategies?

Have sufficient assessments of alternative investments been made to ensure that the project proposal represents a correct choice to proceed with, including quantitative and qualitative benefit analyses and cost/benefit comparisons for each alternative?
Are project manager and other key project participants appointed?
Is role description for project manager established?
Has a rough project justification been developed?
Is the project still desirable and in line with the organization's strategic goals?
Are the project's result objectives with associated products/deliverables suitable to create the desired changes and benefits that were the basis for the assessments in the concept phase?
Has a comprehensive and consistent plan been developed that breaks the project down into manageable phases?
Have necessary strategies for implementation been developed (for example implementation strategy, quality strategy and procurement strategy)?
Is the project organization clearly defined with roles and responsibilities, and are there resources to carry out the project?
Has uncertainty analysis been performed and is the uncertainty acceptable?
Has the benefits manager been actively involved in developing the benefits realization plan?
Has the line organization's capacity to realize the benefits been assessed?
Are the project's deliverables in accordance with defined result objectives?
Are deliverables documented and delivered according to plan?
Is there any outstanding work that the project should be responsible for completing?
Does the benefits manager perceive that the desired benefits are still realistic, and has the benefits realization plan been reviewed and possibly updated during the implementation phase(s)?
Is the line organization ready to use the deliverables from the project and has necessary training, user documentation, operational procedures etc. been developed and implemented?
Is it clear who should follow up and report effects (according to benefits realization plan), and to whom?
Is it clear who is responsible for management and operations, and have the necessary agreements been entered into?
Is outstanding work satisfactorily closed and possibly accepted and transferred to the line organization?
Is the project's main result (product, cost, time, quality, resource usage) documented?
Are positive and negative experiences documented for knowledge transfer?
Are the project documents properly archived?
Have all relevant stakeholders been informed about the closure of the project?
Is the Lessons Learned log updated, closed, and saved?
Have planned measurements and initiatives been implemented?
Have expected benefits been achieved, or is there a need for additional measures? If so, has an action plan been developed?
Decide on investigation of the idea and formulate a first draft of the project mandate
Define a clear problem statement that highlights the need for further investigation
Make it clear how or by whom the investigation will be financed
Assess whether it is most appropriate to carry out the initiative as a project or as a line task
Assess whether the initiative is in accordance with the business strategy
Consider if there are any guidelines (IT-political or others) that apply and must be taken into account in the investigation
Assess whether more information is needed before a decision can be made
Develop final project mandate and present it for decision at Decision Point 1 (DP1)
Conduct DP1 (checklist and possible phase transition) and assess whether we should proceed to the concept phase and investigate different concepts for a possible project
If it has been decided in DP1 to proceed to the concept phase, appoint an investigation leader for the concept phase
Establish the project proposal document for further work (based on the project mandate)
Consider whether a project steering committee should be established
Establish role description for project owner
Establish role description for project manager
Allocate key resources for the project and make necessary agreements to ensure resource access, as well as assemble a project team
Conduct necessary analyses (Socio-economic analysis, QA1, QA2, etc.)
Collect experiences from previous projects and activities that are useful for this project
Establish the project's own experience log
Assess whether the project is realistic and feasible
Assess whether the project proposal supports the organization's goals and strategies

Assess whether a sufficient evaluation of various alternatives has been made to ensure that the project proposal provides a correct choice to proceed with. (Remember quantitative and qualitative benefit analyses and cost/benefit comparisons for each alternative)
Develop final project proposal for decision at Decision Point 2 (DP2)
Complete phase plan for the Planning Phase for decision at Decision Point 2 (DP2)
Conduct DP2 (checklist and possible phase transition) and assess whether to proceed to the planning phase and plan the project in detail
Consider establishing necessary strategies for project implementation (This will vary between different project types. See examples under activities in the Planning Phase on Prosjektveiviseren.no)
Complete the detailed project justification that in total shall ensure that the project is still desirable and in line with the organization's strategic goals
Establish a final project organization with roles and responsibilities, and sufficient resources to implement the project
Conduct uncertainty analysis and assess whether the uncertainty is acceptable
Identify critical success factors and deliverables in the project
Develop a benefits realization plan that includes an assessment of the line organization's capacity to realize the benefits
Develop a comprehensive and consistent implementation plan that breaks the project down into manageable phases with milestones
Develop/collect necessary steering documentation for decision at Decision Point 3 (DP3)
Complete phase plan for first implementation phase for decision at DP3
Conduct DP3 (checklist and possible phase transition) and assess whether to proceed to the implementation phase(s)
Follow up that the project's deliverables are in accordance with defined result goals for the project
Ensure that deliverables are properly documented and delivered according to plan
When approaching the closing phase, assess whether there is any outstanding work that the project should be responsible for closing
Ensure that necessary training, user documentation, operational procedures etc. are developed and implemented
Ensure good dialogue with the line organization along the way, so that it is ready to use the deliverables from the project
Anchor and clarify who should follow up and report effects (according to benefits realization plan), when this should be reported after project completion and to whom
Clarify who has responsibility for further management and operation of the project result, and enter into necessary agreements
Deliver completed project deliverables to the line organization
Update steering documentation (project justification, experience log and benefits realization plan) for decision at Decision Point 4 (DP4)
Complete phase plan for the closing phase for decision at DP4
Conduct DP4 (checklist and possible phase transition) and assess whether to proceed to the closing phase
Complete any remaining tasks and hand over final deliverables to the line organization
Provide agreed support to the line organization during the implementation phase
Ensure that all relevant contracts and agreements are formally closed
Update and close the project accounts
Close and archive project documentation (product, cost, time, quality, resource usage)
Document positive and negative experiences for knowledge transfer to the organization's experience log
Update project justification and benefits realization plan (remember that planned effect measurements should be part of the organization's ordinary management processes to ensure goal achievement)
Evaluate the project and prepare final report
Inform all relevant stakeholders about project closure
Develop/collect necessary steering documentation (final report, updated project justification and benefits realization plan with residual risk) for decision at Decision Point 5 (DP5)
Conduct DP5 (checklist and possible phase transition) and assess whether to close the project and proceed to the realization phase
Ensure that planned measurements and measures are carried out according to the benefits realization plan
Measure whether expected benefits have been achieved or if there is a need for additional measures. If so, develop an action plan
Carry out agreed effect measurements for decision at Decision Point 6 (DP6)
Conduct DP6 (checklist) and assess whether the desired effect has been achieved, and possibly consider new measures
